intro: Omphalocarpum bracteatum, commonly known as the bracted burrpea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, commonly known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spiny pods that enclose its seeds. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought. Its structure includes compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring.
